Existing methods for computing text similarity have focused mainly on either large documents or individual words .We focus on computing the similarity between two sentences or two short paragraphs .The proposed method can be exploited in a variety of applications involving textual knowledge representation and knowledge discovery .

This notion generalizes the well - known notions of semantic similarity , semantic relatedness and semantic distance , which have been extensively studied by various communities over the last decades ( e.g. , Cognitive Science , Linguistics , and Artificial Intelli - gence to mention a few ) .

They are central elements of a large variety of Natural Language Processing applications and knowledge - based treatments , and have therefore naturally been subject to intensive and interdisciplinary research efforts during last decades .Beyond a simple inventory and categorization of existing measures , the aim of this monograph is to convey novices as well as researchers of these domains toward a better understanding of semantic similarity estimation and more generally semantic measures .

In addition , the evaluations of semantic measures , as well as , software solutions dedicated to their computation and analysis are introduced .The general presentation of the large diversity of existing semantic measures is further completed by a detailed survey of measures based on knowledge bases analysis .
